title: Fish Size Project
text:
Fish Size Project






Our Vision



The Fish Size Project is a research group led by Dr. Asta Audzijonyte at the University of Tasmania, Australia. Here, we are investigating everything relating to fish body size. One main research focus is understanding how species body size distributions are being impacted by human harvesting practices and climate change.





Our Aim



Our aim is to….The Fish Size Project is a research group led by Dr. Asta Audzijonyte at the University of Tasmania, Australia. Here, we are investigating everything relating to fish body size. One main research focus is understanding how species body size distributions are being impacted by human harvesting practices and climate change.

Contact



Our aim is to….The Fish Size Project is a research group led by Dr. Asta Audzijonyte at the University of Tasmania, Australia. Here, we are investigating everything relating to fish body size. One main research focus is understanding how species body size distributions are being impacted by human harvesting practices and climate change.

Asta Audzijonyte
Asta is the lead investigator in the fish size project.



Freddie J. Heather
Freddie is a postdoctoral researcher in the group. Freddie is leading analyses into fundamental properties of species body size distributions.



Pia Bessell-Browne



Shane Richards
Audzijonyte et al. (2020) Fish Body Sizes Change with Temperature but Not All Species Shrink with Warming. Nature Ecology and Evolution.
